page.title: 13Local Recipes from Woodhalls
page.content: {PASTIES:}Individual pasties are made with a circle of pastry drawn up round the filling,pressed together and fluted.Here are some fillings:- {TURNIP OR PARSLEY PASTY:}Diced turnip or chopped parsley,cream,seasoning. {SQUAB PIE:}Layered potato,neck of lamb,onion and apple. {MEAT PASTY}:Cubes of raw meat covered with a savoury egg custard. {HOGS PUDDING:}Groats, pigs offal and herbs stuffed in a pig's intestine and boiled. {UPSIDE DOWN TEDDY PIE:}Chopped bacon onion and potato boiled together, topped with a thick suet crust and baked.Served upside down. {TEDDY CAKES:}Mashed potato flour and margarine formed into balls, topped with streaky bacon or steak.Baked in a hot oven.Eaten in the hand.
